Aware Ever Tried Recent Trial Occasional Use Regular Use Most Often Use
summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of product usage across different stages, illustrating a decline in user engagement as usage frequency increases. The categories range from "Aware" to "Most Often Use," with corresponding percentages indicating the proportion of users at each stage. A significant majority, 72%, are "Aware" of the product, while 46% have "Ever Tried" it. The percentage of users decreases substantially for "Recent Trial" (58%), "Occasional Use" (50%), and "Regular Use" (56%). The smallest user group, 5%, falls into the "Most Often Use" category, highlighting a steep drop-off in consistent engagement. This structure reveals a funnel-like progression where initial awareness and trial lead to progressively smaller segments of dedicated, frequent users.
